channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: CISA Warns of Critical ICS Flaws in Fuji, Delta, and Radiometrics Systems
item.description:
Headline: CISA Warns of Critical ICS Flaws in Fuji, Delta, and Radiometrics Systems

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has released five advisories detailing critical vulnerabilities in Industrial Control Systems (ICS) from Fuji Electric, Survision, Delta Electronics, Radiometrics, and IDIS. The flaws, which include buffer overflows and authentication bypasses with CVSS scores up to 10.0, could allow remote code execution and severe disruption of critical infrastructure in sectors like manufacturing, energy, and aviation. CISA is urging immediate review and mitigation, as successful exploitation could lead to loss of control over industrial processes and, in some cases, create hazardous physical conditions.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

Meta Description: CISA has issued five advisories detailing critical vulnerabilities in Industrial Control Systems (ICS) from Fuji Electric, Survision, Delta, Radiometrics, and IDIS, posing risks of RCE and operational disruption.

Article Slug: cisa-exposes-critical-flaws-in-industrial-control-systems

Published Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Conti Successor 'DragonForce' Rebrands as Cartel, Deploys Advanced Ransomware
item.description:
Headline: Conti Successor 'DragonForce' Rebrands as Cartel, Deploys Advanced Ransomware

Summary:
The ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) group DragonForce, which builds upon leaked Conti v3 source code, has rebranded itself as a 'cartel' and is actively recruiting affiliates. According to research from Acronis, the group has upgraded its malware to use a 'bring your own vulnerable driver' (BYOVD) technique to disable security software, using drivers like `truesight.sys`. The group has also been linked to the notorious financially motivated threat actor Scattered Spider, expanding its reach and sophistication. DragonForce has already listed over 200 victims on its leak site, targeting industries like retail, airlines, and MSPs.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Malware

Meta Description: The DragonForce ransomware group, using leaked Conti source code, has rebranded as a 'cartel,' using BYOVD techniques to disable security software and collaborating with Scattered Spider.

Article Slug: dragonforce-cartel-emerges-from-conti-with-upgraded-ransomware

Published Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Insider Threat Shocker: Cybersecurity Pros Charged in BlackCat Ransomware Conspiracy
item.description:
Headline: Insider Threat Shocker: Cybersecurity Pros Charged in BlackCat Ransomware Conspiracy

Summary:
In a startling insider threat case, U.S. federal prosecutors have indicted three cybersecurity professionals for allegedly conspiring to deploy the BlackCat/ALPHV ransomware against at least five U.S. companies. The accused include an incident response manager from the cybersecurity firm Sygnia and two ransomware negotiators from DigitalMint. The group is charged with using their specialized knowledge to conduct attacks between May and November 2023, exfiltrating data and extorting millions in ransom payments from victims in the healthcare, engineering, and manufacturing sectors.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Regulatory

Meta Description: Three U.S. cybersecurity professionals, including an incident response manager, have been indicted for allegedly deploying BlackCat/ALPHV ransomware to extort millions from American companies.

Article Slug: cybersecurity-insiders-indicted-for-blackcat-ransomware-attacks

Published Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA Adds Actively Exploited Gladinet and CWP Flaws to KEV Catalog
item.description:
Headline: CISA Adds Actively Exploited Gladinet and CWP Flaws to KEV Catalog

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added two new vulnerabilities to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, confirming they are under active attack. The flaws include an information disclosure bug in Gladinet CentreStack/Triofox (CVE-2025-11371) and an OS command injection vulnerability in CWP Control Web Panel (CVE-2025-48703). Under Binding Operational Directive (BOD) 22-01, federal agencies are mandated to patch these vulnerabilities by a specified deadline, and CISA strongly urges all organizations to prioritize remediation to defend against these active threats.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Threat Intelligence

Meta Description: CISA has added two actively exploited vulnerabilities, CVE-2025-11371 in Gladinet and CVE-2025-48703 in CWP, to its KEV Catalog, mandating federal agencies to patch.

Article Slug: cisa-adds-actively-exploited-gladinet-cwp-flaws-to-kev-catalog

Published Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Swedish IT Firm Breach Exposes Data of 1.5 Million, Sparks GDPR Probe
item.description:
Headline: Swedish IT Firm Breach Exposes Data of 1.5 Million, Sparks GDPR Probe

Summary:
The Swedish IT services firm Miljödata has suffered a severe data breach, exposing the personal and potentially sensitive information of over 1.5 million people. The incident, which occurred in late August, resulted in the stolen data being published on the darknet. In response, the Swedish Data Protection Authority (IMY) has launched a major investigation under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), targeting both Miljödata and several of its public sector clients, including the City of Gothenburg and Region Västmanland.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Meta Description: A data breach at Swedish IT services firm Miljödata has compromised the personal information of over 1.5 million people, leading to a major GDPR investigation by the Swedish Data Protection Authority (IMY).

Article Slug: swedish-it-firm-miljodata-breach-exposes-1-5-million

Published Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: State-Sponsored Hackers Breach F5, Steal BIG-IP Source Code, Posing Major ICS/OT Risk
item.description:
Headline: State-Sponsored Hackers Breach F5, Steal BIG-IP Source Code, Posing Major ICS/OT Risk

Summary:
F5 has disclosed a major security breach by a state-sponsored threat actor, identified as UNC5221, who gained prolonged access to the company's BIG-IP engineering and development environments. The attack resulted in the compromise of sensitive source code, vulnerability details, and some customer data. This supply chain attack poses a significant threat to critical infrastructure sectors worldwide, as many organizations rely on F5 BIG-IP appliances to secure the boundary between their IT and sensitive OT/ICS networks. The access to source code could allow the actor to discover and weaponize new zero-day vulnerabilities.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems

Meta Description: F5 has confirmed a major security breach by state-sponsored threat actor UNC5221, who gained access to BIG-IP engineering environments, exposing source code and posing a significant threat to critical infrastructure.

Article Slug: state-sponsored-hackers-breach-f5-big-ip-posing-ics-ot-risk

Published Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Identity is the New Perimeter: Stolen Credentials and Over-Privileged Accounts Drive Cloud Breaches
item.description:
Headline: Identity is the New Perimeter: Stolen Credentials and Over-Privileged Accounts Drive Cloud Breaches

Summary:
A consensus is forming across the cybersecurity industry: identity is the new security perimeter in the cloud. New reports from ReliaQuest and Amazon Web Services (AWS) reveal that identity-based attacks are the leading driver of cloud security incidents. Key findings show that compromised credentials caused 20% of breaches, while a staggering 99% of cloud identities are 'over-privileged,' possessing excessive permissions. Experts are urging a strategic shift away from network-centric security and towards a 'zero standing privileges' model, where access is granted on a temporary, as-needed basis to mitigate this massive attack surface.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Cloud Security, Security Operations, Policy and Compliance

Meta Description: Security reports reveal that identity-based attacks, fueled by stolen credentials and over-privileged cloud identities, are the leading cause of cloud security incidents, urging a move to zero standing privileges.

Article Slug: identity-is-the-new-perimeter-cloud-attacks-driven-by-stolen-credentials

Published Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Ernst & Young Exposes 4TB Database Backup on Public Azure Server
item.description:
Headline: Ernst & Young Exposes 4TB Database Backup on Public Azure Server

Summary:
Global professional services firm Ernst & Young (EY) has reportedly suffered a major data exposure after a 4-terabyte SQL Server database backup file was left publicly accessible on a Microsoft Azure cloud server. The misconfiguration, discovered by security researchers, exposed a `.BAK` file that likely contained a vast amount of sensitive information, including internal user data, API keys, system credentials, and database schemas. This incident underscores the severe risks associated with simple cloud configuration errors, even at large, security-conscious organizations.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security, Security Operations

Meta Description: A 4TB SQL database backup file from global firm Ernst & Young (EY) was exposed on a misconfigured Microsoft Azure server, potentially leaking sensitive user data, API keys, and credentials.

Article Slug: ernst-young-exposes-4tb-sensitive-data-in-azure-misconfiguration

Published Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Hackers Claim Breach and Full Database Theft from Russian Nuclear Waste Facility 'Radon'
item.description:
Headline: Hackers Claim Breach and Full Database Theft from Russian Nuclear Waste Facility 'Radon'

Summary:
A threat actor has posted on a data leak forum claiming to have breached Radon, a Russian state-owned enterprise responsible for nuclear waste management and operated by the nuclear giant Rosatom. The attackers allege they have stolen the company's entire database, which reportedly includes sensitive test statistics, user IDs, and the personal information of employees. Security experts warn that if the claim is legitimate, the breach poses a severe risk, as the data could be used to forge safety documents, endanger physical safety, or launch sophisticated spear-phishing campaigns against Russia's critical nuclear infrastructure.

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Industrial Control Systems

Meta Description: A threat actor has claimed a breach of Radon, a nuclear waste management plant operated by Russia's Rosatom, allegedly stealing the company's entire database of test stats and employee information.

Article Slug: hackers-claim-breach-of-russian-nuclear-waste-facility-radon

Published Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: APT-C-60 Updates Tactics in Ongoing Espionage Campaign Against Japan
item.description:
Headline: APT-C-60 Updates Tactics in Ongoing Espionage Campaign Against Japan

Summary:
The state-sponsored threat group APT-C-60 is continuing its cyber-espionage campaign targeting Japan and other East Asian regions, according to a new report from JPCERT/CC. The group has updated its TTPs, now attaching malicious VHDX files directly to spear-phishing emails rather than using download links. The attack chain involves a user opening the VHDX, clicking an LNK file, and executing a script via a legitimate Git executable. The group has also shifted its C2 infrastructure from Bitbucket to GitHub and updated its SpyGlace backdoor, demonstrating a persistent and evolving threat.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

Meta Description: JPCERT/CC reports that threat group APT-C-60 is continuing its cyber-espionage campaigns against Japan with updated tactics, including malicious VHDX attachments and the use of GitHub for C2.

Article Slug: apt-c-60-renews-attacks-on-japan-with-updated-malware-and-tactics

Published Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: F5 Hacked by Nation-State Actor; BIG-IP Source Code Stolen
item.description:
Headline: F5 Hacked by Nation-State Actor; BIG-IP Source Code Stolen

Summary:
F5 Networks has disclosed a severe security incident involving a 'highly sophisticated nation-state threat actor' that gained long-term access to its development environment. The attackers, suspected to be the Chinese espionage group UNC5221, successfully stole source code for F5's flagship BIG-IP products. While F5 found no evidence of a software supply chain compromise, the theft of these 'digital blueprints' creates a significant risk of future zero-day vulnerabilities. The Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) has issued an urgent advisory, and F5 released a large batch of 44 new vulnerability patches concurrently with the disclosure.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: F5 Networks reveals a sophisticated nation-state actor breached its development environment, stealing source code for BIG-IP products. The attack is linked to the suspected Chinese espionage group UNC5221.

Article Slug: f5-discloses-nation-state-breach-source-code-stolen

Published Date: Fri, 17 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 17 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 05 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Insider Threat: Cybersecurity Pros Charged in BlackCat Ransomware Spree
item.description:
Headline: Insider Threat: Cybersecurity Pros Charged in BlackCat Ransomware Spree

Summary:
In a shocking case of insider threat, U.S. federal prosecutors have indicted two cybersecurity professionals, Ryan Clifford Goldberg and Kevin Tyler Martin, for their role in a series of ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware attacks. The individuals, who worked in incident response and ransomware negotiation, allegedly used their specialized knowledge to extort at least five U.S. companies between May and November 2023. The attacks targeted organizations across multiple sectors, including healthcare and manufacturing, with one victim paying over $1.2 million in ransom. This case highlights the grave risks posed by malicious insiders within the cybersecurity industry itself.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: Federal prosecutors charge two cybersecurity professionals, Ryan Clifford Goldberg and Kevin Tyler Martin, for deploying ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware against U.S. companies.

Article Slug: cybersecurity-professionals-indicted-for-blackcat-ransomware-attacks

Published Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Patch Now: Critical Zero-Click RCE Flaw Hits Billions of Android Devices
item.description:
Headline: Patch Now: Critical Zero-Click RCE Flaw Hits Billions of Android Devices

Summary:
Google's November 2025 Android Security Bulletin has put users on high alert with the disclosure of CVE-2025-48593, a critical zero-click remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability. The flaw, residing in the Android System component, affects Android versions 13, 14, 15, and 16. Its most dangerous characteristic is that it can be exploited remotely without any user interaction, potentially allowing an attacker to take full control of a device. Google has released patches, and users are urged to update their devices to the 2025-11-01 security patch level or later immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Mobile Security, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Google's November 2025 Android Security Bulletin reveals a critical zero-click RCE vulnerability, CVE-2025-48593, affecting Android versions 13 through 16.

Article Slug: critical-android-zero-click-rce-flaw-cve-2025-48593

Published Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Millions of Devs at Risk: Critical RCE Flaw in Popular React Native Package
item.description:
Headline: Millions of Devs at Risk: Critical RCE Flaw in Popular React Native Package

Summary:
A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, CVE-2025-11953, has been discovered in a popular React Native command-line tool, putting millions of developers at risk. The flaw, rated 9.8 on the CVSS scale, exists in the '@react-native-community/cli' NPM package and allows an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on a developer's machine by sending a malicious request to the Metro development server. This could lead to source code theft, malware injection, or a full-blown supply chain attack. Meta has released a patch, and developers are strongly urged to update their dependencies.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Supply Chain Attack, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: A critical remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2025-11953) with a 9.8 CVSS score has been found in a widely used React Native NPM package, affecting millions of developers.

Article Slug: critical-rce-vulnerability-in-react-native-npm-package-cve-2025-11953

Published Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Conti's Ghost: New 'DragonForce' Ransomware Adopts Cartel Model
item.description:
Headline: Conti's Ghost: New 'DragonForce' Ransomware Adopts Cartel Model

Summary:
A new ransomware operation named DragonForce has been identified by security researchers, notable for its use of leaked source code from the infamous Conti ransomware. Instead of a traditional Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) model, DragonForce operates with a 'cartel-like' structure, providing affiliates with a builder to create their own branded ransomware variants. This approach facilitates the rapid proliferation of new threats, with groups like 'Devman' already seen deploying malware created with the DragonForce builder. The core malware retains Conti's technical features, including its encryption scheme and ability to spread via SMB.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Malware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: Security researchers uncover DragonForce, a new ransomware group using leaked Conti source code and a novel 'cartel-style' model to recruit affiliates and build custom malware variants.

Article Slug: dragonforce-ransomware-emerges-from-leaked-conti-code-with-cartel-model

Published Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: SK Telecom Profit Plummets 90% After Data Breach Hits 27M Customers
item.description:
Headline: SK Telecom Profit Plummets 90% After Data Breach Hits 27M Customers

Summary:
South Korean telecommunications giant SK Telecom has suffered a catastrophic financial blow, reporting a 90% drop in its third-quarter operating profit. The dramatic decline is a direct result of a massive data breach disclosed in April, which compromised the sensitive personal data of approximately 27 million customers. The costs, stemming from a record regulatory fine of $96.5 million and a $349 million 'customer appreciation package,' underscore the devastating and long-lasting financial consequences of major cybersecurity failures.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: South Korean telecom giant SK Telecom suffers a 90% drop in operating profit due to the immense costs of a data breach that compromised the personal data of 27 million customers.

Article Slug: sk-telecom-profits-plummet-90-percent-after-massive-data-breach

Published Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Everest Ransomware Claims Hits on AT&T, Dublin Airport, and Swedish Power Grid
item.description:
Headline: Everest Ransomware Claims Hits on AT&T, Dublin Airport, and Swedish Power Grid

Summary:
The Everest ransomware group has made bold claims of responsibility for a series of high-profile cyberattacks, alleging the theft of massive amounts of data from major international entities. The targets reportedly include U.S. telecom giant AT&T, Dublin Airport, the airline Air Arabia, and Sweden's power grid operator, Svenska kraftnät. The group claims to have exfiltrated millions of customer and employee records and hundreds of gigabytes of internal data, highlighting a focus on critical infrastructure and data-rich organizations.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The Everest ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a series of high-profile attacks, allegedly stealing data from AT&T, Dublin Airport, Air Arabia, and Sweden's power grid operator.

Article Slug: everest-ransomware-claims-attacks-on-att-dublin-airport-and-svenska-kraftnat

Published Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: EU Stress-Tests Cyber Defenses in Large-Scale Crisis Simulation
item.description:
Headline: EU Stress-Tests Cyber Defenses in Large-Scale Crisis Simulation

Summary:
The European Union has concluded its 2025 'Blueprint Operational Level Exercise' (BlueOLEx), a large-scale simulation designed to test and improve the bloc's collective response to major cybersecurity crises. Hosted in Cyprus with support from the EU's cybersecurity agency, ENISA, the exercise brought together senior officials from all member states to role-play a significant cyber incident affecting critical sectors. The drill was the first to test the new EU Cyber Blueprint, which aims to clarify roles and streamline coordination between national authorities and the European Commission during a cross-border attack.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Security Operations

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The European Union tests its collective cybersecurity crisis response mechanisms in the 2025 'Blueprint Operational Level Exercise' (BlueOLEx), simulating a major incident affecting critical sectors.

Article Slug: eu-tests-joint-cyber-crisis-response-in-blueolex-2025-exercise

Published Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Philippine Police Brace for Coordinated DDoS Attacks on Government Websites
item.description:
Headline: Philippine Police Brace for Coordinated DDoS Attacks on Government Websites

Summary:
The Philippine National Police (PNP) has mobilized its cybersecurity units and placed them on high alert in anticipation of a potential large-scale distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) campaign targeting government websites. According to intelligence, the attacks are slated to begin on November 5, 2025. The PNP is coordinating with the Department of Information and Communications Technology (DICT) and other national agencies to harden critical digital infrastructure and prepare rapid response teams to mitigate any disruption to public services.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Cyberattack, Security Operations, Policy and Compliance

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The Philippine National Police (PNP) heightens its cybersecurity defenses in anticipation of a potential wave of distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks targeting government websites.

Article Slug: philippine-police-on-high-alert-for-anticipated-ddos-attacks

Published Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Cl0p Ransomware Exploits Oracle E-Business Suite Zero-Day, Hits Major Corporations
item.description:
Headline: Cl0p Ransomware Exploits Oracle E-Business Suite Zero-Day, Hits Major Corporations

Summary:
The notorious Cl0p ransomware gang is the primary suspect behind a new wave of attacks exploiting a zero-day remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Oracle E-Business Suite. The flaw, tracked as CVE-2025-61882, affects the Oracle Concurrent Processing component and has allegedly been used to breach several major corporations. Victims include mining company Pan American Silver, energy giant Schneider Electric, and communications conglomerate Cox Enterprises. Data from the latter two has already been leaked on Cl0p's dark web site, demonstrating the group's continued proficiency in weaponizing zero-day vulnerabilities in enterprise software.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Ransomware, Vulnerability, Data Breach

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: The Cl0p ransomware gang is believed to be exploiting a zero-day RCE vulnerability, CVE-2025-61882, in Oracle E-Business Suite to breach major corporations and leak data.

Article Slug: cl0p-ransomware-exploits-oracle-e-business-suite-zero-day-cve-2025-61882

Published Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Homeland Security Warns Gov't Shutdown and Lapsed Law Cripple U.S. Cyber Defenses
item.description:
Headline: Homeland Security Warns Gov't Shutdown and Lapsed Law Cripple U.S. Cyber Defenses

Summary:
The U.S. House Committee on Homeland Security has issued a stark warning in its latest 'Cyber Threat Snapshot,' stating that the nation's ability to defend against cyber threats is being severely hampered. The report cites a dual crisis: a federal government shutdown that furloughs key cybersecurity personnel, and the lapse of the Cybersecurity Information Sharing Act of 2015. This creates 'dangerous blind spots' at a time of heightened threat activity from nation-state actors like China and Iran, and a surge in attacks against U.S. critical infrastructure.

Severity: High

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Report

Meta Description: The U.S. House Committee on Homeland Security's 'Cyber Threat Snapshot' warns that a federal shutdown and lapsed information-sharing laws are weakening the nation's cyber defenses.

Article Slug: us-homeland-security-warns-of-rising-cyber-threats-amid-shutdown

Published Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: US Cyber Threat Sharing Law 'CISA 2015' Expires, Creating Potential Intelligence Gap
item.description:
Headline: US Cyber Threat Sharing Law 'CISA 2015' Expires, Creating Potential Intelligence Gap

Summary:
The Cybersecurity Information Sharing Act of 2015 (CISA 2015), a foundational U.S. law that provided liability protections to encourage private companies to share cyber threat data with the government, expired on October 1, 2025. Amidst a government shutdown and a block by Senator Rand Paul, lawmakers failed to reauthorize the act. Security and legal experts warn this could have a chilling effect on threat intelligence sharing, with one law firm predicting a potential 80% drop. The lapse creates uncertainty and could hinder national cybersecurity efforts. In response, new legislation, the PACT Act, has been introduced to retroactively restore and extend the protections, but its future is uncertain.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: CISA 2015, Cybersecurity Information Sharing Act, PACT Act, threat intelligence sharing, cybersecurity policy, US law, liability protection

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Cybersecurity Information Sharing Act of 2015 (CISA 2015) has expired, removing key liability protections and sparking fears of a dramatic drop in public-private cyber threat intelligence sharing.

Article Slug: key-us-cyber-information-sharing-law-expires-sparking-concerns

Published Date: Fri, 10 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 10 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1
